events.originalText: A Russian Sukhoi Su-24 attack aircraft was shot down by a Turkish fighter jet after the former allegedly strayed into Turkish airspace and ignored warnings to change course.
events.subtitle: Sukhoi Su-24
events.headline: Russian Su-24 shot down by Turkish fighter jet

events.originalText: A fire at a clothing factory in the Ashulia district on the outskirts of Dhaka, Bangladesh, killed at least 117 people.
events.subtitle: 2012 Dhaka garment factory fire
events.headline: Fire at clothing factory in Bangladesh kills 117

events.originalText: The Avdhela Project, an Aromanian digital library and cultural initiative, is launched in Bucharest, Romania.
events.subtitle: Avdhela Project
events.headline: Avdhela Project launched in Bucharest, Romania

events.originalText: A magnitude 7.3 earthquake struck eastern Turkey, destroying 80 per cent of the buildings in the area, with at least 4,000 casualties.
events.subtitle: 1976 Çaldıran–Muradiye earthquake
events.headline: 7.3 magnitude earthquake hits eastern Turkey, 4,000 casualties

events.originalText: A group of paleoanthropologists led by Donald Johanson discovered a 3.2-million-year-old Australopithecus afarensis skeleton in Ethiopia, nicknaming it Lucy (pictured) after the Beatles song "Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds".
events.subtitle: Paleoanthropology
events.headline: Paleoanthropologists discover 3.2-million-year-old skeleton in Ethiopia

events.originalText: After collecting a ransom payout of $200,000, D. B. Cooper (depicted) parachuted out of the rear stairway of the airplane he had hijacked over the Pacific Northwest and disappeared.
events.subtitle: D. B. Cooper
events.headline: D.B. Cooper parachutes after ransom payout

events.originalText: During a live television broadcast, businessman Jack Ruby shot and fatally wounded Lee Harvey Oswald, who assassinated U.S. president John F. Kennedy, fueling numerous conspiracy theories.
events.subtitle: Jack Ruby
events.headline: Jack Ruby fatally shoots Lee Harvey Oswald on live TV

events.originalText: The "Great Appalachian Storm", a large extratropical cyclone, struck the east coast of the United States before moving northeast.
events.subtitle: Great Appalachian Storm of 1950
events.headline: Great Appalachian Storm strikes U.S. east coast

events.originalText: World War II: Following the American capture of Makin Atoll, USS Liscome Bay was sunk by a torpedo from Japanese submarine I-175, killing 644.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: USS Liscome Bay sunk by Japanese submarine, 644 killed

events.originalText: The Holocaust: The Theresienstadt Ghetto was founded as a waystation to Nazi extermination camps and a "retirement settlement" for elderly and prominent Jews to mislead their communities about the Final Solution.
events.subtitle: The Holocaust
events.headline: Theresienstadt Ghetto founded during Holocaust

events.originalText: The Eugene O'Neill Theatre opened on Broadway, New York, with a production of the musical Mayflowers.
events.subtitle: Eugene O'Neill Theatre
events.headline: Eugene O'Neill Theatre opens on Broadway with Mayflowers

events.originalText: Irish Civil War: Irish nationalist author Erskine Childers was executed by the Irish Free State for illegally carrying a semi-automatic pistol.
events.subtitle: Irish Civil War
events.headline: Irish nationalist Erskine Childers executed for carrying pistol

events.originalText: The second of two games between two Ohio football teams took place, after which accusations were made that players conspired to deliberately lose games.
events.subtitle: American football
events.headline: Accusations of game-fixing between Ohio football teams

events.originalText: American Civil War: As part of the Chattanooga campaign in Chattanooga, Tennessee, Union forces captured Lookout Mountain, helping them to begin breaking the Confederate siege of the city.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Union forces capture Lookout Mountain in Chattanooga campaign

events.originalText: British naturalist Charles Darwin's On the Origin of Species was first published, and sold out its initial print run on the first day.
events.subtitle: Charles Darwin
events.headline: Charles Darwin's On the Origin of Species published

events.originalText: Tarabai, the former regent of the Maratha Empire, had Rajaram II, whom she had previously claimed to be her grandson, arrested as an impostor.
events.subtitle: Tarabai
events.headline: Tarabai has Rajaram II arrested as impostor

events.originalText: Anglo-Scottish Wars: England captured about 1,200 Scots with a victory at the Battle of Solway Moss.
events.subtitle: Anglo-Scottish Wars
events.headline: England captures 1,200 Scots at Battle of Solway Moss

events.originalText: Mongol invasion of the Khwarazmian Empire: Genghis Khan defeated the renegade Khwarazmian prince Jalal al-Din at the Battle of the Indus.
events.subtitle: Mongol invasion of the Khwarazmian Empire
events.headline: Genghis Khan defeats Khwarazmian prince at Battle of the Indus
